commit_message:
Multi REST API calls error handling of "volume unset" command

Support multi REST API calls error handling for "volume unset"
command follow the rule in doc/source/command-errors.rst.
Also add a unit test for testing the error handling

Change-Id: I2de7a7bd5a7a5e39817ed5cf6952abf4afba75e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/59/366059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_volume_unset_image_property_fail(self): self.volumes_mock.delete_image_metadata.side_effect = ( exceptions.CommandError()) arglist = [ '--image-property', 'Alpha', '--property', 'Beta', self.new_volume.id, ] verifylist = [ ('image_property', ['Alpha']), ('property', ['Beta']), ('volume', self.new_volume.id), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser( self.cmd_unset, arglist, verifylist) try: self.cmd_unset.take_action(parsed_args) self.fail('CommandError should be raised.') except exceptions.CommandError as e: self.assertEqual('One or more of the unset operations failed', str(e)) self.volumes_mock.delete_image_metadata.assert_called_with( self.new_volume.id, parsed_args.image_property) self.volumes_mock.delete_metadata.assert_called_with( self.new_volume.id, parsed_args.property)

commit_message:
Updated from openstack-manuals

- Update reference to Networking service (neutron)

Change-Id: I0b5f43dc98623d24914936fd689474f57eb50529
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/34/369734/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Networking service (neutron) The OpenStack projects which implements services and associated libraries to provide on-demand, scalable, and technology-agnostic network abstraction. Networking API (Neutron API) Codename for OpenStack :term:`Networking service <Networking Service (neutron)>`. An alternative name for :term:`Networking API <Networking API (Neutron API)>`.
deleted_lines: Networking service A core OpenStack project that provides a network connectivity abstraction layer to OpenStack Compute. The project name of Networking is neutron. Networking API A core OpenStack project that provides a network connectivity abstraction layer to OpenStack Compute. An alternative name for Networking API.

commit_message:
Add fuel2 commands to operate on extensions

Releases new fuel2 commands to operate on extensions:
    fuel2 env extension enable
    fuel2 env extension disable
    fuel2 env extension show
    fuel2 extension list

DocImpact

Also, this change introduces the option for BaseListCommand for
specifying the default fields to sort by.

Change-Id: Idee06633689efece18838766de5c4afcd24190d7
Implements: blueprint extensions-management
Partial-Bug: #1614526
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/91/356591/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_extension_arg(help_msg): return get_arg( 'extensions', flags=('--extensions',), nargs='+', default=[], help=help_msg )

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-08 06:13:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/65524d3b01e56b4ea572c9ece60fd70f32eb56f9', 'message': "Serialization of destroyed objects

If the destroyed object was saved back to the object graph it will
appear in the resulting serialized object model JSON. Thus it is
important to save the fact that it was destroyed so that upon next
deployment it won't become regular live object again.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Change-Id: I6a9144001f43a502e25db8a3410e4a32cf04fb04
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-08 07:08:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/495b5504ac9eb3ab65cd15ac79b8ca2bc375d6a4', 'message': "Serialization of destroyed objects

If the destroyed object was saved back to the object graph it will
appear in the resulting serialized object model JSON. Thus it is
important to save the fact that it was destroyed so that upon next
deployment it won't become regular live object again.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Change-Id: I6a9144001f43a502e25db8a3410e4a32cf04fb04
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-08 07:45:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/45cc88ed66f8e57f326ce0d9752a63a54f8fb068', 'message': "Serialization of destroyed objects

If the destroyed object was saved back to the object graph it will
appear in the resulting serialized object model JSON. Thus it is
important to save the fact that it was destroyed so that upon next
deployment it won't become regular live object again.

commit_message:
Serialization of destroyed objects

If the destroyed object was saved back to the object graph it will
appear in the resulting serialized object model JSON. Thus it is
important to save the fact that it was destroyed so that upon next
deployment it won't become regular live object again.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Change-Id: I6a9144001f43a502e25db8a3410e4a32cf04fb04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/62/366562/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Raise exception on call of method of destroyed object

In theory using destruction dependencies one can obtain a new
reference to an object that is about to be destroyed. In this
case any attempt to call a method on such object should result
in exception being raised. This guarantees that the nothing can
be done on the object after its .destroy method was executed.

Also because the HeatStack instance is owned by the CloudRegion
it is going to be destroyed prior to it. But CloudRegion needs
to call $stack.delete() in its .destroy method and this will cause
error. As a solution HeatStack made not to be owned by the
region and instead be an independent object with destruction
dependency on it which guarantees that it will be destroyed
after the CloudRegion.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Change-Id: I5650ea672d5f121be69669f27dd5f513fbdd5c44

commit_message:
Changes for multiple backend conf and friendly plugin names (Part 2)

Added feature flag to enable/disable multiple backend support.

Added friendly plugin name in secretstore and crypto plugins conf.

Modified way of defining multiple plugin conf. With multiple backend
support, now plugins supported and global default plugin is defined
explictly in service configuration. With feature flag on, plugins
to be loaded are identified via reading new configuration structure.

Change-Id: I3c761c5a441f42c9f54a67d72514e8c1357a2e6a
Partially-Implements: blueprint multiple-secret-backend

added_lines: from barbican.model import models from barbican.model import repositories ), cfg.BoolOpt('enable_multiple_secret_stores', default=False, help=u._('Flag to enable multiple secret store plugin' ' backend support') )class MultipleStorePreferredPluginMissing(exception.BarbicanException): """Raised when a preferred plugin is missing in service configuration.""" def __init__(self, store_name): super(MultipleStorePreferredPluginMissing, self).__init__( u._("Preferred Secret Store plugin {store_name} is not " "currently available. This is probably a server " "misconfiguration.").format( store_name=store_name) ) self.store_name = store_name OPAQUE = utils.SECRET_TYPE_OPAQUEdef sync_secret_stores(conf=None): """Synchronize secret store plugin names between service conf and database :param conf service configuration instance This method reads secret and crypto store plugin name from service configuration and then synchronizes corresponding data maintained in database SecretStores table. Any new plugin name(s) added in service configuration is added as a new entry in SecretStores table. If order of plugin names is changed to make change in default secret store, then global_default flag is updated to reflect that change. If plugin name is removed from service configuration, then removal is possible as long as respective plugin names are NOT set as preferred secret store for a project. If it is used and plugin name is removed, then error is raised. This logic is intended to be invoked at server startup so any error raised here will result in critical failure. """ secretstore_plugins = conf.secretstore.enabled_secretstore_plugins crypto_plugins = conf.crypto.enabled_crypto_plugins secret_stores_repo = repositories.get_secret_stores_repository() proj_store_repo = repositories.get_project_secret_store_repository() session = secret_stores_repo.get_session() # get existing secret stores data from database db_stores = secret_stores_repo.get_all(session=session) # read secret store data from service configuration conf_stores = [] for i, store_plugin in enumerate(secretstore_plugins): if i < len(crypto_plugins): crypto_plugin = crypto_plugins[i] else: crypto_plugin = None conf_stores.append(models.SecretStores(store_plugin=store_plugin, crypto_plugin=crypto_plugin, global_default=(i == 0))) if db_stores: def fn_match(lh_store, rh_store): return (lh_store.store_plugin == rh_store.store_plugin and lh_store.crypto_plugin == rh_store.crypto_plugin) for conf_store in conf_stores: # find existing db entry for plugin using conf based plugin names db_store_match = next((db_store for db_store in db_stores if fn_match(conf_store, db_store)), None) if db_store_match: # update existing db entry if global default is changed now if db_store_match.global_default != conf_store.global_default: db_store_match.global_default = conf_store.global_default # persist flag change. db_store_match.save(session) # remove matches store from local list after processing db_stores.remove(db_store_match) else: # new conf entry as no match found in existing entries secret_stores_repo.create_from(conf_store, session=session) # entries still present in db list are no longer configured in service # configuration, so try to remove them provided there is no project # is using it as preferred secret store. for db_store in db_stores: if proj_store_repo.get_count_by_secret_store(db_store.id) == 0: secret_stores_repo.delete_entity_by_id(db_store.id, None, session=session) else: raise MultipleStorePreferredPluginMissing(db_store.name) else: # initial setup case when there is no secret stores data in db for conf_store in conf_stores: secret_stores_repo.create_from(conf_store, session=session) def get_preferred_plugin(manager, project_id): plugin_dict = {ext.name: ext.obj for ext in manager.extensions if ext.obj} if manager.multiple_secret_stores_enabled: proj_store_repo = repositories.get_project_secret_store_repository() proj_store = proj_store_repo.get_secret_store_for_project( project_id, None, suppress_exception=True) if proj_store: preferred_plugin_name = getattr(proj_store.project_store, manager.plugin_lookup_field) if preferred_plugin_name in plugin_dict: plugins = [plugin_dict.get(preferred_plugin_name)] else: raise MultipleStorePreferredPluginMissing( proj_store.project_store.name) else: plugins = plugin_dict.values() return plugins self.multiple_secret_stores_enabled = \ conf.secretstore.enable_multiple_secret_stores if self.multiple_secret_stores_enabled: sync_secret_stores(conf=conf) self.plugin_lookup_field = "store_plugin" invoke_kwds=invoke_kwargs, name_order=True # extensions sorted as per order of plugin names

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from glanceclient.common import utils from glanceclient import exc from oslo_utils import encodeutils import six from six.moves.urllib import parse class Controller(object): def __init__(self, http_client, type_name=None): self.http_client = http_client self.type_name = type_name self.default_page_size = 20 self.sort_dir_values = ('asc', 'desc') def _check_type_name(self, type_name): """Check that type name and type versions were specified""" type_name = type_name or self.type_name if type_name is None: msg = "Type name must be specified" raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) return type_name def _validate_sort_param(self, sort): """Validates sorting argument for invalid keys and directions values. :param sort: comma-separated list of sort keys with optional <:dir> after each key """ for sort_param in sort.strip().split(','): key, _sep, dir = sort_param.partition(':') if dir and dir not in self.sort_dir_values: msg = ('Invalid sort direction: %(sort_dir)s.' ' It must be one of the following: %(available)s.' ) % {'sort_dir': dir, 'available': ', '.join(self.sort_dir_values)} raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) return sort def create(self, name, version='0.0.0', type_name=None, **kwargs): """Create an artifact of given type and version. :param name: name of creating artifact. :param version: semver string describing an artifact version """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) kwargs.update({'name': name, 'version': version}) url = '/artifacts/%s' % type_name resp, body = self.http_client.post(url, data=kwargs) return body def update(self, artifact_id, type_name=None, remove_props=None, new_values=None): """Update attributes of an artifact. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to modify. :param remove_props: List of property names to remove :param \*\*kwargs: Artifact attribute names and their new values. """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) url = '/artifacts/%s/%s' % (type_name, artifact_id) hdrs = {'Content-Type': 'application/json-patch+json'} changes = [] if remove_props: for prop_name in remove_props: if prop_name not in new_values: changes.append({'op': 'remove', 'path': '/%s' % prop_name}) for prop_name in new_values: changes.append({'op': 'replace', 'path': '/%s' + prop_name, 'value': new_values[prop_name]}) resp, body = self.http_client.patch(url, headers=hdrs, data=changes) return body def get(self, artifact_id, type_name=None): """Get information about an artifact. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to get. """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) url = '/artifacts/%s/%s' % (type_name, artifact_id) resp, body = self.http_client.get(url) return body def list(self, type_name=None, **kwargs): """Retrieve a listing of Image objects. :param page_size: Number of images to request in each paginated request. :returns: generator over list of artifacts. """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) limit = kwargs.get('limit') page_size = kwargs.get('page_size') or self.default_page_size def paginate(url, page_size, limit=None): next_url = url while True: if limit and page_size > limit: next_url = next_url.replace("limit=%s" % page_size, "limit=%s" % limit) resp, body = self.http_client.get(next_url) for artifact in body['artifacts']: yield artifact if limit: limit -= 1 if limit <= 0: raise StopIteration try: next_url = body['next'] except KeyError: return filters = kwargs.get('filters', {}) filters['limit'] = page_size url_params = [] for param, items in six.iteritems(filters): values = [items] if not isinstance(items, list) else items for value in values: if isinstance(value, six.string_types): value = encodeutils.safe_encode(value) url_params.append({param: value}) url = '/artifacts/%s' % type_name for param in url_params: url = '%s&%s' % (url, parse.urlencode(param)) if 'sort' in kwargs: url = '%s&sort=%s' % (url, self._validate_sort_param( kwargs['sort'])) for artifact in paginate(url, page_size, limit): yield artifact def active(self, artifact_id, type_name=None): """Set artifact status to 'active'. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to get. """ return self.update(artifact_id, type_name, new_values={'status': 'active'}) def deactivate(self, artifact_id, type_name=None): """Set artifact status to 'deactivated'. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to get. """ return self.update(artifact_id, type_name, new_values={'status': 'deactivated'}) def reactivate(self, artifact_id, type_name=None): """Set artifact status to 'active'. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to get. """ return self.update(artifact_id, type_name, new_values={'status': 'active'}) def publish(self, artifact_id, type_name=None): """Set artifact visibility to 'public'. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to get. """ return self.update(artifact_id, type_name, new_values={'visibility': 'public'}) def delete(self, artifact_id, type_name=None): """Delete an artifact and all its data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to delete. """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) url = '/artifacts/%s/%s' % (type_name, artifact_id) self.http_client.delete(url) def upload_blob(self, artifact_id, blob_property, data, type_name=None): """Upload blob data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to download a blob :param blob_property: blob property name """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) hdrs = {'Content-Type': 'application/octet-stream'} url = '/artifacts/%s/%s/%s' % (type_name, artifact_id, blob_property) self.http_client.put(url, headers=hdrs, data=data) def download_blob(self, artifact_id, blob_property, type_name=None, do_checksum=True): """Get blob data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to download a blob :param blob_property: blob property name :param do_checksum: Enable/disable checksum validation. """ type_name = self._check_type_name(type_name) url = '/artifacts/%s/%s/%s' % (type_name, artifact_id, blob_property) resp, body = self.http_client.get(url) checksum = resp.headers.get('content-md5', None) content_length = int(resp.headers.get('content-length', 0)) if checksum is not None and do_checksum: body = utils.integrity_iter(body, checksum) return utils.IterableWithLength(body, content_length)

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: I8ff4f30c23a002a10a083cea6bdbd8d678748867

commit_message:
Do not show "os-volume-type-access:is_public" property of volume type

"os-volume-type-access:is_public" property is the
same as "is_public" property in volume type object.
So stop showing "os-volume-type-access:is_public"
property and leave "is_public" property only.

Change-Id: Ic78a9ee69b0ab356edff18cdb4c46fc24b495d2b
Closes-Bug: #1620922

commit_message:
Pass receiver to :GC.subscribeDestruction explicitly

Makes the subscriber object be an explicit parameter of
destruction dependency subscribe/unsibscribe method. It makes
possible use of this functions from static methods and to link
other objects.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Change-Id: I2554385bf2ebc6849f09939530a7c090fb745778

deleted_lines: def subscribe_destruction(target, handler=None): caller_context = helpers.get_caller_context() receiver = helpers.get_this(caller_context) target_this, receiver, handler) dependency = {'subscriber': helpers.weak_ref(receiver), def unsubscribe_destruction(target, handler=None): caller_context = helpers.get_caller_context() receiver = helpers.get_this(caller_context) target_this, receiver, handler)

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2016-09-08 06:02:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/d4f3e2f500363606131c6d33cae4848008ce4190', 'message': 'On-demand garbage collection

Garbage collection is triggered by io.murano.system.GC.collect()
static method. Garbage collector destroys all object that are not
reachable anymore. GC can handle objects with cross-references and
isolated object graphs. When portion of object model becomes not
reachable it destroyed in predictable order such that child objects get
destroyed before their parents and, when possible, before objects
that are subscribed to their destruction notifications.

Internally, both pre-deployment garbage collection (that was done by
comparision of ``Objects`` and ``ObjectsCopy``) and post-deployment
orphan object collection are now done through the new GC.

MuranoPL GC utilizes Python GC to track and collect objects.
The main idea is to make ObjectStore have weak links only and
prevent hard links in other dsl places so that only links between objects
remain. Then prevent Python GC to automatically delete objects that
are not used anymore and use gc.collect() to obtain a list of
objects that are both not reachable and cannot be destroyed and then
destroy them in the correct order.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Closes-Bug: #1619635
Change-Id: I653d8f71f003afa0a1ea588c9d14198571f5ad14

commit_message:
On-demand garbage collection

Garbage collection is triggered by io.murano.system.GC.collect()
static method. Garbage collector destroys all object that are not
reachable anymore. GC can handle objects with cross-references and
isolated object graphs. When portion of object model becomes not
reachable it destroyed in predictable order such that child objects get
destroyed before their parents and, when possible, before objects
that are subscribed to their destruction notifications.

Internally, both pre-deployment garbage collection (that was done by
comparision of ``Objects`` and ``ObjectsCopy``) and post-deployment
orphan object collection are now done through the new GC.

MuranoPL GC utilizes Python GC to track and collect objects.
The main idea is to make ObjectStore have weak links only and
prevent hard links in other dsl places so that only links between objects
remain. Then prevent Python GC to automatically delete objects that
are not used anymore and use gc.collect() to obtain a list of
objects that are both not reachable and cannot be destroyed and then
destroy them in the correct order.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Closes-Bug: #1619635
Closes-Bug: #1597747
Change-Id: I653d8f71f003afa0a1ea588c9d14198571f5ad14

subject: Remove deprecated configuration option network_device_mtu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 08:25:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9ae6c19beb8decbf78fb7b969a2858ef54852029', 'message': 'Remove deprecated configuration option network_device_mtu

Change-Id: I2fc98cbd5845f59a886899d0ecea68a6634a8d18
Todo: add more details
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-21 08:37:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8d7c8e4e72d1c1b4db6d54be181df2c46fa4ddfe', 'message': 'Remove deprecated configuration option network_device_mtu

The network_device_mtu option in Nova is deprecated for removal since
network MTU should be specified when creating the network with
nova-network. With Neutron networks, the MTU value comes from the
segment_mtu configuration option in Neutron.

Change-Id: I2fc98cbd5845f59a886899d0ecea68a6634a8d18
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-24 04:55:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e3748059bf83332fd1d74af34627c13922e511fc', 'message': 'Remove deprecated configuration option network_device_mtu

UpgradeImpact: The network_device_mtu option in Nova is deprecated
for removal in 13.0.0 since network MTU should be specified when
creating the network with nova-network. With Neutron networks,
the MTU value comes from the segment_mtu configuration option in Neutron.

Change-Id: I2fc98cbd5845f59a886899d0ecea68a6634a8d18
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-07 03:33:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/13c768a9a080e8b2d4d71635995c8262dba50f45', 'message': 'Remove deprecated configuration option network_device_mtu

UpgradeImpact: The network_device_mtu option in Nova is deprecated
for removal in 13.0.0 since network MTU should be specified when
creating the network with nova-network. With Neutron networks,
the MTU value comes from the segment_mtu configuration option in

commit_message:
Remove deprecated configuration option network_device_mtu

UpgradeImpact: The network_device_mtu option in Nova is deprecated
for removal in 13.0.0 since network MTU should be specified when
creating the network.

Change-Id: I2fc98cbd5845f59a886899d0ecea68a6634a8d18

Optional database prepare

In some cases nailgun database could already exist
and ready for use. In this case we don't need
to do anything when preparing database.

[api-ref]: Update link reference

This patch updates link reference for "create keypair" in
Compute API create server [1].
Current reference link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#createKeypair
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#createFloatingIP
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#addFloatingIp
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#removeFloatingIp
Update reference link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-or-import-keypair
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute
/#create-allocate-floating-ip-address
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute
/#delete-deallocate-floating-ip-address
[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=
create-server-detail#create-server

commit_message:
Cluster code looks for wrong field in request for volume type

The cluster code on the server side is looking for a field called
'volume_type' in the request. The correct field should be 'type'.

Closes-Bug: #1623005
Change-Id: I5f46b887e028819dcd2d18da6390d38401528194
Author:    chenshujuan <chenshujuan@chinac.com>
Owner:    chenshujuan <chenshujuan@chinac.com>

commit_message:
Fix dhcp_disabled ip_version error

Update a VM port with --extra-dhcp-opt opt_name="dhcp_disabled",\
opt_value=True,ip_version=6 will disable dhcpv4 for this port.

This patch fixes that.

Closes-bug: #1622799
Change-Id: I1388f37f29d8a7dff54fea99d010bbe009c1797e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/07/369107/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_port_dhcpv4_options_port_dhcp_disabled_1(self): def test_get_port_dhcpv4_options_port_dhcp_disabled_2(self): port = { 'id': 'foo-port', 'device_owner': 'compute:None', 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': 'foo-subnet', 'ip_address': '10.0.0.11'}], 'extra_dhcp_opts': [{'ip_version': 4, 'opt_name': 'dhcp_disabled', 'opt_value': 'False'}, {'ip_version': 6, 'opt_name': 'dhcp_disabled', 'opt_value': 'True'}] } expected_dhcpv4_opts = { 'cidr': '10.0.0.0/24', 'external_ids': {'subnet_id': 'foo-subnet'}, 'options': {'router': '10.0.0.1', 'mtu': '1400'}} self.mech_driver._nb_ovn.get_subnet_dhcp_options.return_value = ( expected_dhcpv4_opts) self.assertEqual(expected_dhcpv4_opts, self.mech_driver.get_port_dhcpv4_options(port)) self.mech_driver._nb_ovn.add_dhcp_options.assert_not_called() self.mech_driver._nb_ovn.get_port_dhcp_options.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
Include marker file for release notes

This is so that we can create a list of directories to ignore when we
rsync documentation builds to a publishing site. Some builds are
published as subdirectories underneath the results of superior builds.
This allows those superior builds to be rsynced without removing the
other builds that were published under them.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/65/369665/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ================================= Initial environment configuration ================================= OpenStack-Ansible depends on various files that are used to build an inventory for Ansible. Start by getting those files into the correct places: #. Copy the contents of the ``/opt/openstack-ansible/etc/openstack_deploy`` directory to the ``/etc/openstack_deploy`` directory. .. note:: As of Newton, the ``env.d`` directory has been moved from this source directory to ``playbooks/inventory/``. #. Change to the ``/etc/openstack_deploy`` directory. #. Copy the ``openstack_user_config.yml.example`` file to ``/etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml``. You can review the ``openstack_user_config.yml`` file and make changes to the deployment of your OpenStack environment. .. note:: The file is heavily commented with details about the various options. Configuration in ``openstack_user_config.yml`` defines which hosts will run the containers and services deployed by OpenStack-Ansible. For example, hosts listed in the ``shared-infra_hosts`` run containers for many of the shared services that your OpenStack environment requires. Some of these services include databases, memcached, and RabbitMQ. There are several other host types that contain other types of containers and all of these are listed in ``openstack_user_config.yml``. For details about how the inventory is generated from the environment configuration, see :ref:`developer-inventory`.

commit_message:
Use centos7-master-head DLRN instance for includepkgs repo

By default the centos7 master repo points to the DLRN instance
which is building only master of projects outside of upper-constraints.
This is a problem for our includepkgs repo, because we rely on it
including all merged code.

There is another DLRN instance that is building master of everything,
so we should switch the includepkgs repo to that.

Change-Id: Iabd9fa9d9f71626f209fe5b41ec985c87452667a
Depends-On: Ia608ac7184f7285dda08061861ea70a0fc181ae4
Closes-Bug: 1623063

commit_message:
Use centos7-master-head DLRN instance for includepkgs repo

By default the centos7 master repo points to the DLRN instance
which is building only master of projects outside of upper-constraints.
This is a problem for our includepkgs repo, because we rely on it
including all merged code.

There is another DLRN instance that is building master of everything,
so we should switch the includepkgs repo to that.

Change-Id: Ia608ac7184f7285dda08061861ea70a0fc181ae4
Partial-Bug: 1623063

commit_message:
Improve _check_depolying_status to handle nodes in maintenance

1. Improve _check_depolying_status to handle nodes in maintenance
mode
2. _fail_if_in_state method will not forcibly exclude nodes
in maintenance. This will depend on the filter.
3. Add maintenance=False to _check_inspect_timeouts's filters.

Change-Id: Ia2a9446adeaf53b3c8a005cbf781ec14dc593ed9
Partial-Bug: #1587694

commit_message:
Cleanup, clarify newton release-notes

This commit clarifies, cleans and improves releasenotes for murano

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 18:57:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/046b37fecd0fff1e1a83d425b06fa27a7c77c5b1', 'message': "Break cyclic references in DSL

DSL a cyclic references between objects were created.
Thus the object model objects were not automatically
deleted upon deployment finish even if there were no
cross-links between the objects in object model.

performance due to
1) For LHS expressions there is no more need to parse
 yaql function definitions upon each variable modification
 because now the base LHS context is fixed and static
2) In most cases the objects now are reclaimed immediately
 after deployment finish thus python GC doesn't have to
 traverse large graphs

commit_message:
Break cyclic references in DSL

Because of several bugs/code design issues in the
DSL a cyclic references between objects were created.
Thus the object model objects were not automatically
deleted upon deployment finish even if there were no
cross-links between the objects in object model.

This commit both breaks the links and increases engine
performance due to
1) For LHS expressions there is no more need to parse
 yaql function definitions upon each variable modification
 because now the base LHS context is fixed and static
2) In most cases the objects now are reclaimed immediately
 after deployment finish thus python GC doesn't have to
 traverse large graphs

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation

Change-Id: I4b1e0038bf7c08ced357fa20c4b1e3d612c93ae9

added_lines: def weak_ref(obj): if obj is None or isinstance(obj, weakref.ReferenceType): return obj return weakref.ref(obj)

commit_message:
Remove the useless host in site.yml

We use hosts detective in wrong. No need add the other hosts we do not
need in the role.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2d228704cd76fc59f590497e33e1b89f397c0e3c
Signed-off-by: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/22/224022/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Get executable events API ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/state-api This blueprint proposes the new API which retrieves a list of executable events for the node. Problem description =================== Currently, Ironic State Machine is implemented, but the only way which operators can know that which event is executable for the node (For example, provisioning state of the node is "available", executable event is "active".) is the document: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/dev/states.html So that, if this document is left not updated, operators cannot operate nodes correctly unless reading source codes. When operators execute provision API/command with invalid event, they can know that the event is invalid, but which event they can execute. For example, when executing "ironic node-set-provision-state <uuid> inspect" command for the node of which provisioning state is "available", we can get below error message: The requested action "inspect" can not be performed on node <uuid> while it is in state "available". (HTTP 400) Operators cannot know which event they can execute for the node with such an error message. Proposed change =============== Implement API: GET /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/events List executable events for the node. * Parameters: + node_ident(uuid_or_name) - the UUID or logical name of a node. * Returns: A json object with the list of executable events. + Example: {"events": ["inspect", "zap", "provide"]} Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- Add a new API GET /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/events . Please see "Proposed change". Client (CLI) impact ------------------- Add a new command executes API GET /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/events . ironic node-executable-events (node_ident) RPC API impact -------------- None. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: takada-yuiko Work Items ---------- * Add API retrieves a list of executable events for the node and bump API microversion. * Add CLI executes above API. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= pgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None. Documentation Impact ==================== Update API document adding a new API References ========== None.

commit_message:
Allow Neutron to be run in DVR mode

Introduces a new property "enable_neutron_dvr", along with the
appropriate service and template changes to allow DVR.

Closes-Bug: #1623463
DocImpact: dvr changes network data paths and adds requirements for NICs
Co-Authored-By: Vladislav Belogrudov <vladislav.belogrudov@oracle.com>
Change-Id: I87a26e9258228ae2ccb76be1e5f0bb44fac128df

commit_message:
Enable usage reporting for Calico/OpenStack deployments

Calico now has a usage reporting feature, to help the Calico team
understand how Calico is being used.  To enable this, the
orchestrator (such as networking-calico) writes a 'Cluster GUID' into
etcd, to uniquely identify the cluster.  Then each instance of Calico's
agent (Felix) reports itself with that Cluster GUID.

Therefore, this change generates and writes a Cluster GUID, for
Calico/OpenStack deployments.

(In case you do not want your usage of networking-calico to be reported,
set /calico/v1/config/UsageReportingEnabled to false in etcd.)

Change-Id: Iea3bd3021849d8c660c30943810701e3b914fae5
Sem-Ver: feature
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/43/369343/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid cluster_guid = None cluster_guid_key = datamodel_v1.key_for_config('ClusterGUID') cluster_guid = self.client.read(cluster_guid_key).value LOG.info('%s -> true', reporting_key) if not cluster_guid: # Generate and write a globally unique cluster GUID. Write it # idempotently into the datastore. The prevExist=False creates the # value (safely with CaS) if it doesn't exist. guid = uuid.uuid4() guid_string = guid.get_hex() try: self.client.write(cluster_guid_key, guid_string, prevExist=False) except etcd.EtcdAlreadyExist: # ignore pass

commit_message:
Changing get_token to get_scoped_token for neutron templates

As all services except keystone should use scoped tokens,
modifying the templates to reflect the same.

Change-Id: I130947d2293ef56cd1082a2d7089077218ea8938
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/40/370240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: X-Auth-Token: CALL_EXTERNAL|syntribos.extensions.identity.client:get_scoped_token_v3:["user"]|

subject: Treat ec2 collector data as immutable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 01:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/collect.py', 'os_collect_config/exc.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_collect.py', 'os_collect_config/ec2.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_ec2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config/commit/8717436db99a84588532e792f8c9ea909f3e3628', 'message': 'Treat ec2 collector data as immutable

Currently the ec2 collector polls the nova metadata service every
$polling_period even though the data is not expected to change and no
known config actions have been written to respond to changes in these
values.

With larger overclouds, this metadata polling will cause noticeable
load on the undercloud, especially nova-api and neutron (for port
lookups).

This change allows collect calls to raise a SourceAlreadyCollected
exception if the data for this collector never changes. The ec2
collector raises this if its data has already been cached to
/var/lib/os-collect-config/ec2.json

Change-Id: Ib7df590601132857690c8ab64fe32098a81752d8
Closes-Bug: #1619072
'}]
commit_message:
Treat ec2 collector data as immutable

Currently the ec2 collector polls the nova metadata service every
$polling_period even though the data is not expected to change and no
known config actions have been written to respond to changes in these
values.

With larger overclouds, this metadata polling will cause noticeable
load on the undercloud, especially nova-api and neutron (for port
lookups).

This change allows collect calls to raise a SourceAlreadyCollected
exception if the data for this collector never changes. The ec2
collector raises this if its data has already been cached to
/var/lib/os-collect-config/ec2.json

Change-Id: Ib7df590601132857690c8ab64fe32098a81752d8
Closes-Bug: #1619072
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config refs/changes/21/364021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json import osfrom oslo_config import cfg def test_collect_ec2_collected(self): collect.setup_conf() cache_dir = self.useFixture(fixtures.TempDir()) self.addCleanup(cfg.CONF.reset) cfg.CONF.set_override('cachedir', cache_dir.path) ec2_path = os.path.join(cache_dir.path, 'ec2.json') with open(ec2_path, 'w') as f: json.dump(META_DATA, f) collect_ec2 = ec2.Collector(requests_impl=FakeFailRequests) self.assertRaises(exc.Ec2MetadataAlreadyCollected, collect_ec2.collect)

subject: Add port creation passing the name of the node instead of the UUID of the node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 07:25:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/f5aa7cc99d570d8ebf832cbf5f193a6c87d03810', 'message': "Adds port creation passing the name of the node instead of the UUID of the node

A port can be created via a POST /v1/ports, with 'node_uuid' and 'address' specified in the body.
Now that we have logical node names, we should allow the port creation to accept the name of the node instead of the UUID of the node. Eg, add 'node' with either a UUID or name as its value, and deprecate 'node_uuid'.

Change-Id: I84420c6dadf184ba34770479c172599fd7b3a605
Related-Bug: #1439901

commit_message:
Add port creation passing the name of the node instead of the UUID of the node

A port can be created via a POST /v1/ports, with 'node_uuid' and 'address'
specified in the body.
Now that we have logical node names, we should allow the port creation to
accept the name of the node instead of the UUID of the node. Eg, add
'node' with node name as its value.

Change-Id: I84420c6dadf184ba34770479c172599fd7b3a605
Related-Bug: #1439901

commit_message:
Introduce an identity_admin role to policy.json

From an OpenStack-wide perspective, the identity_admin role has a subset
of the authorization provided to global_admin (previously "admin"), and
has complete authority over the identity API. Similarly, the
compute_admin role would have complete authority over the compute API.

This is a part of the cross-project conventional roles spec (bp
common-default-policy):

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245629/

Change-Id: I8aab9085f4ba29618b39c8021f8d8e3ce828551f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/43/274143/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Supersede the "admin" role with "global_admin"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 22:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json', 'etc/policy.json'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/af3d75c91ea1a2c28de8bfa89f84d4a1f5c021a9', 'message': 'Supersede the "admin" role with "global_admin"

Due to its prevalence today, we need to maintain compatibility with the
"admin" role. However, in order to provide additional explicitness going
forward about the true nature of the "admin" role, it will become
synonymous with "global_admin". A user with this role is all-powerful
and is expected to be able to do anything in OpenStack.

By not impacting functional tests, this change demonstrates backwards
compatibility with previous expectations around the "admin" role.

This is a part of the cross-project conventional roles spec:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245629/

Change-Id: I4429291416ac476ef98f1506ef6e1de7b74861f7
'}]
commit_message:
Supersede the "admin" role with "global_admin"

Due to its prevalence today, we need to maintain compatibility with the
"admin" role. However, in order to provide additional explicitness going
forward about the true nature of the "admin" role, it will become
synonymous with "global_admin". A user with this role is all-powerful
and is expected to be able to do anything in OpenStack.

By not impacting functional tests, this change demonstrates backwards
compatibility with previous expectations around the "admin" role.

This is a part of the cross-project conventional roles spec:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245629/

Change-Id: I4429291416ac476ef98f1506ef6e1de7b74861f7

commit_message:
Add unit tests for 'ironic/common/config_generator/generator.py'

There are no unit tests for: ironic/common/config_generator/generator.py
A new file should be created called:
ironic/tests/unit/common/config_generator/test_generator.py
And tests should be put into that file.

Change-Id: Iaf47bd4300eebe07da04251b2f8b289b90fc661a
Closes-bug: #1525211
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/23/280123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- encoding: utf-8 -*- # # Copyright 2013 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from oslo_config import cfg from ironic.common.config_generator import generator from ironic.common.i18n import _ from ironic.tests import base class ValidateGeneratorTestData(object): api_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('string_option', default='test', choices=['test', 'test_aside'], help=_('string option for test')), cfg.BoolOpt('bool_option', default=False, help=_('bool option for test')), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(api_opts) api_opts_none_default = [ cfg.StrOpt('not_default', default='test_string_not_default', help=_('string option for nonu default test')), ] opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='simple', title='A Simple Example') CONF.register_group(opt_group) CONF.register_opts(api_opts_none_default, opt_group) class GeneratorException(Exception): pass def mock_print_group_opts(group, opts_by_module): opt_list = [] for mod, opts in sorted(opts_by_module, key=lambda x: x[0]): for opt in opts: opt_list.append(opt.dest) expect_list = [] if group == 'DEFAULT': expect_list = ['string_option', 'bool_option'] elif group == 'simple': expect_list = ['not_default'] expect_list.sort() opt_list.sort() if expect_list != opt_list: raise GeneratorException("Options not as expected") class ValidateGeneratorTestCase(base.TestCase): def test_generate(self): import_return = mock.Mock(return_value=ValidateGeneratorTestData) generator._import_module = import_return print_function = mock.Mock(side_effect=mock_print_group_opts) generator.print_group_opts = print_function generator.generate(['-m', 'ValidateGeneratorTestData'])

commit_message:
Add cluster support for affinity/anti-affinity

Added a locality pulldown to specify None/affinity/anti-affinity
in the launch cluster dialog.

Modified the horizon trove api to use the new locality parameter in
the launch cluster dialog.

Change-Id: Iac08b34958408d81aaf7bc0cd699bdafb7e7d3d7
Closes-Bug: #1611919

commit_message:
Prevent use filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data)

In Python3 [1], if we need filter on python3, replace
filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)]. This patch replaces
filter function and introduces a hacking rule to prevent
using filter in future.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I83d22108c02f8da007a7233e71a4a7fb833170ec

commit_message:
Check duplicate nodes in node verifying process

This patch is intended to check duplicate nodes enrollment.

Change-Id: I6d5139a7fff7e1b96afaa6636bf461d49bc9c08d
Closes-Bug: #1549664

commit_message:
Added ReleaseAttributesMetadataHandler

This handler is needed in order to be able to update
release attributes metadata not updating release itself.

Change-Id: Id2f591b78e0a591ed8f18cc5326528d8efb3a3c4
Implements: blueprint fuelclient-modify-release-repos
Closes-Bug: 1620501
(cherry picked from commit e2e81ea1d2bca2a8feb41741236f05366410b146)

Merge tag '1.24.0' into debian/newton

commit_message:
Updated the readme file to add missing commands.

Added commands in readme file to point to the correct inventory
file and run grafana on HA proxy.

Change-Id: I14756b8986738a558f63d497b617dbc40f4d977d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/48/369548/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add the export to update the inventory file location .. code-block:: bash export ANSIBLE_INVENTORY=/opt/openstack-ansible/playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py If you are running the HA Proxy you should run the following playbook as well to enable the grafana port 8089 .. code-block:: bash openstack-ansible playbook-metrics-lb.yml

commit_message:
Towards python-centric repo

This patch moves much of the Java build stuff from the topmost build.xml file
that woulds eventually get replaced with setup.py

In addition we push down the java storlets tests and implementation
down the tree, to comply with the python structure. During
merge with python code, added intermediate test classes
one for Python and one for Java that hide some details

Finally, we cleanup some old unused files under tests

Bonus:
 - Fix the Ansible behind "ant deploy_container_agent"
 - Fix what seems to be a bug in the daemog factory
   that considers ECHILD as unknown error

Change-Id: Ib503b529719e6a877fd0b1df24597f47cf471192

commit_message:
Fix api-ref doc for server-rebuild

This fixes the name parameter which should be referencing the optional
server name instead of the security group name. It also deletes an entry
in the parameters.yaml which is not referenced anywhere.

Change-Id: I38abe55aa46f54a22468e21188e0cd5ef2c63244

commit_message:
Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone

From python 2.7 onwards, some new method such as assertIsNone
equivalent to the assertEqual,this will simplify the number of
parameters.

I am looking for all the assert method, which can be updated and
renewed,and changed the place where I think they can change.
These changes should be harmless

refer to [1] for more information

[1]:https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.assertIsNone

Closes-Bug #1618434
Change-Id: I67db37a0f7561c638d5bb8f2ccd894fa07f6109e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/10/362810/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIsNone(entry.content) self.assertIsNone(entry.priority)

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I17e692108c058ba393eb2a81b8814f879956a991

commit_message:
Remove novncproxy and spice from reload

Since these services don't use RPC, we don't need to reload them. And
these caused problems in gates.

Change-Id: I6967bdc7da0d0c3c06873e3d554124ca995f4c13
Closes-Bug: #1622117
(cherry picked from commit 8cd59db6f641c4ee494dae6916b30207476c4a9e)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 07:48:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/8a3b51b45f7d5267bc1be42d36f0c88e292a87a7', 'message': "Improve distribution detection in create_vm_nodes-for-role.sh

commit_message:
Improve distribution detection in create_vm_nodes-for-role.sh

Move distribution detection code into a function and query the
/etc/os-release file which should exist on all recent distributions. If
that fails, use the old method instead. Finally, we add support for
SUSE based distributions.

Change-Id: I34fc704fc79d1ad130f716007c5cf704772ac6e6
Signed-off-by: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/58/363458/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function is_distro { if [ ! -e /etc/os-release ]; then echo "/etc/os-release is missing" >&2; exit 1 fi case "$1" in centos) grep -q -i "centos" /etc/os-release ;; debian) grep -q -i "debian" /etc/os-release ;; suse) grep -q -i "suse" /etc/os-release ;; *) echo "Unsupported distribution '$1'" >&2; exit 1 ;; esac } if is_distro "centos"; then if is_distro "centos" || is_distro "suse"; then if is_distro "debian"; then if ! is_distro "centos"; then
deleted_lines: if [ -e /etc/centos-release ]; then if [ -e /etc/centos-release ]; then if [ -f /etc/debian_version ]; then if [ ! -e /etc/centos-release ]; then

commit_message:
Lower verbosity on memcached server

This change lowers the default log level for memcached. currently with the
setting at -vv we're noticing a large spike in logs generated which could
fill up block devices on high traffic systems.

Change-Id: I3378f4cce3a082060f4b202034b48975040a79fe
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

It has been automatically generated using cookiecutter[1] and msync[2]

[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-modulesync-configs

Change-Id: I614a3d93947705a7a74820017bc568c6de197bea

added_lines: # == Class: glare::keystone::auth # # Configures glare user, service and endpoint in Keystone. # # === Parameters # # [*password*] # (required) Password for glare user. # # [*auth_name*] # Username for glare service. Defaults to 'glare'. # # [*email*] # Email for glare user. Defaults to 'glare@localhost'. # # [*tenant*] # Tenant for glare user. Defaults to 'services'. # # [*configure_endpoint*] # Should glare endpoint be configured? Defaults to 'true'. # # [*configure_user*] # (Optional) Should the service user be configured? # Defaults to 'true'. # # [*configure_user_role*] # (Optional) Should the admin role be configured for the service user? # Defaults to 'true'. # # [*service_type*] # Type of service. Defaults to 'key-manager'. # # [*region*] # Region for endpoint. Defaults to 'RegionOne'. # # [*service_name*] # (optional) Name of the service. # Defaults to the value of 'glare'. # # [*service_description*] # (optional) Description of the service. # Default to 'glare FIXME Service' # # [*public_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's public url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*admin_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's admin url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*internal_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's internal url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME') # class glare::keystone::auth ( $password, $auth_name = 'glare', $email = 'glare@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $configure_endpoint = true, $configure_user = true, $configure_user_role = true, $service_name = 'glare', $service_description = 'glare FIXME Service', $service_type = 'FIXME', $region = 'RegionOne', $public_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME', $admin_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME', $internal_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:FIXME', ) { if $configure_user_role { Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'glare-server' |> } Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${service_name}::${service_type}"] ~> Service <| name == 'glare-server' |> keystone::resource::service_identity { 'glare': configure_user => $configure_user, configure_user_role => $configure_user_role, configure_endpoint => $configure_endpoint, service_name => $service_name, service_type => $service_type, service_description => $service_description, region => $region, auth_name => $auth_name, password => $password, email => $email, tenant => $tenant, public_url => $public_url, internal_url => $internal_url, admin_url => $admin_url, } }

commit_message:
Remove requiretty for sudo on centos

The default configuration on centos is to requiretty.
adding a file to allow root not to requiretty in /etc/sudoers.d/

Change-Id: I5dce9b5fd63407a27e9a1ad4cbb40e9918c41157

commit_message:
support constraints in api-ref-src jobs

The macro didn't correctly handle the use of upper constraints, we
need to put that back into the mix to get the api-ref-src jobs
working.

Change-Id: I1dff14d6c7b8730109da2ae70367f94d2c589138

commit_message:
Update SHA for openstack_openrc role

This updates the SHA for the openstack_openrc role to ensure
that the https://review.openstack.org/370009 is included in
the next tag rather than waiting for the next collective SHA
bump.

Change-Id: I0543002899d6ce153a833e1d5f3abe69a70a6d52

commit_message:
Adding object name[space] parameters

With Jewel the ceph-osd daemon will refuse to start if the configured
rados max object name length cannot be safely stored [1],[2].

Adding options for osd_max_object_name_len and osd_max_object_namespace_len,

1. http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/16187
2: http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/configuration/filesystem-recommendations/#filesystems

Change-Id: Id487d6d656e88dfe29eac80c378058551c92dfd9

Change-Id: I8eab597378350f41e88f16644fbedf1a32b0b6fa
'}]
commit_message:
Adding Dmitry Tantsur candidacy for Ironic

Change-Id: I8eab597378350f41e88f16644fbedf1a32b0b6fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/47/370147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I am announcing my candidacy for PTL for the Ironic team for the Ocata release cycle. In case you don't know me, I'm dtantsur on IRC. I started working on Ironic around late spring or summer 2014, and I'm probably best known as a founder of ironic-inspector sub-project. The Newton cycle was a huge breakthrough for the Bare metal project. Testing upgrades in CI, multi-tenant networking, support for multiple compute services out of box are just a few great and highly-expected things that have become the reality during this cycle. As for Ocata, I would like to concentrate on unfinished tasks, CI and technical dept. To be more precise, if you happen to choose me as your new PTL for the Ocata cycle, I would like to shift focus to and be the driving force behind these fields of improvement: * Driver improvements and unification First of all, this comprises the driver composition reform - my long-term commitment which I finally plan to fulfill this cycle. However, I would also like us to think more about unification between drivers. Several non-core things very from driver to driver: UEFI support, RAID support and capabilities discovery immediately come to my mind as examples. Finally, this involves parting with drivers that do not have 3rd party CI. I am ready to share responsibility for this unpopular move :) * CI improvements The number of our jobs keeps growing, but we still don't cover a lot of features that Ironic provides. We need to figure out the way to increase coverage without increasing load on infra and number of transient failures. A few approaches come to my mind. Using projects like TripleO as 3rdparty CI may cover a few more things specific to its use case. Puppet experience with "scenarios" may also come in handy to replace several jobs with one. No matter which approach we take, we will need to make sure that it's still clear (especially to newcomers) what caused a particular CI failure. * Finishing Newton goals We've done great job landing features in Newton, but a few important things are still missing. For example, booting from volume, rescue mode, port groups, rolling upgrades, dealing with automatic maintenance in a more robust way, and some more. -- Dmitry Tantsur

Add Senlin Ansible role

commit_message:
Disable osic-cloud8 for now

We are seeing some performance issues with osic-cloud8, for the moment
disable the cloud until we can investigate.  This was causing jobs in
the gate queue to timeout and fail.

Change-Id: I52e600551b0e79af1175a82b4c4f5f21ff05ba78
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Optional database prepare

In some cases nailgun database could already exist
and ready for use. In this case we don't need
to do anything when preparing database.

Change-Id: I865eefd44af0dd1062f27b789d60515d55d7b4d2

commit_message:
List providers for tenants

If the tenants want to create a protection plan,
they need to list providers firstly,
so we need to list providers for tenants.

Change-Id: I3e9013a0e5214d72875256c066196fce412f6336

commit_message:
Consistently round down timestamps

This is one of the ways we can prevent race conditions with backends that round
datetime objects or strings before persisting them.

Change-Id: Iaee0ec8c7acd512b9d93096ce8306a2952061c7a
Closes-Bug: 1622010

commit_message:
Monitoring driver keep monitoring, even if vnf status showing ERROR

After successful creation of a VNF, if mgmt_call fail due to any
reason(ex failed to connect), it will set VNF status to ERROR. But
monitoring driver still keep monitoring to this vnf. Fixing this
issue to avoid unnecessory ping.

Change-Id: I8bfba0875c6025012ce8da4a0b7da34072b9305f
Closes-Bug: #1593567

Initialize correctly collector

When the collector stop some object attribut can be missing.
This change ensure eveything is initialized in __init__.

commit_message:
Use relative paths in ci-scripts for quickstart.sh

All our CI jobs are entering the $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart directory
as it can be seen in the JJB files[1]. The use of absolute path for
quickstart.sh blocks the proper use of the --no-clone option that would
let the user use a different $OOOQ_DIR than
$WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-infra/ci-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/tripleo-quickstart-builders.yml

Change-Id: Ib6cfa096d96ca61f4d6f674cbfac74aaf3c8c23f

commit_message:
Make pip_install honour pip_install_options

Add a pip_install_options variable to the extra_args parameter of
the nstall pip packages task.

The variable is set to a default value of "" in the roles default
variables.

Closes-Bug: 1620872
(cherry picked from commit 571fe1f12725260e86ed8e40eb6a3e0f527218fc)

Change-Id: Ib6fb55f9f6d7c19336aee52354b91728bd9f5502
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/21/369121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove store_events options

The current option is misnamed, as it does not enable any storing but
just the processing of events from the notification agent to the
collector.

This means that even if you set event_dispatchers=panko and forget to
set store_events=true, nothing will happen.

This patch enable the event processing as soon as something is
configured in the pipeline.

Change-Id: I5a906684f6371b0548ac08cacc13aa238f780f78

commit_message:
Remove sql-expire-samples-only as a CLI option

This option actually changes the behaviour of the driver, so it should
not be passed only as a CLI option, but should be set in the
configuration file.

Change-Id: I3540b2db1c039320e387d7a0484b351b082d00de

commit_message:
WIP: Cloning bare metal disk to glance image

This spec introduces the changes in Ironic to support making
bare metal node disk cloning to glance image.

Change-Id: I026bed46fd1a8a0580818da2ad42e4cefa272421
Partial-Bug: #1526311
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/98/301498/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Baremetal disk cloning ==================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1526311 This RFE introduces the changes in Ironic to support making bare metal node disk cloning. Problem description =================== Ironic supports to 'copy' the disk image to bare metal hard disk now, but for end user, it is useful for them to 'reverse provisioning'/'cloning' the whole disk systems to glance/cinder-volume for future rebooting. Then they can deploy the backup image on any time to restore to backup point in the future, no need to deploy new fresh system and install user software, do configurations again and again. The cloning user scenarios: #. User provisioned bare metal with cloud images #. User installed more software and changed some configurations for their applications/services #. Now, maybe the user want to: #.. Clone this node to more, to avoid repeatedly manually steps for each nodes, such as for the cluster scaling-out #.. Migrate the physical node and restore the OS for Hardware failure cases #.. Migrate this OS to another bare metal which has high flavor level(scaling-up) #.. Migrate local disk to storage volume #.. Routine system backup, etc. The cloning scenarios we can support: #. S1. Cloning user baremetal local disk to glance image(default RI with glance clone driver) #. S1. Cloning user baremetal local disk to Cinder volume #. S2. Cloning user baremetal local disk to Ceph disk(Ceph clone driver) #. S3. Cloning user baremetal Cinder booting disk to Glance image #. S4. Cloning user baremetal Cinder booting disk to Cinder volume .. note:: #. Offline cloning supported only, need to power off baremetal first, and restart it after the user disk is copied. #. For last two scenarios, depends on the boot-from-cinder function supporting. So we will implement the first S1 scenario as the default reference implementations. But we will define the common interface as cloning extension points. The work flow of scenario S1 is as below: #. User powers off the bare metal node. #. User run ironic node-clone command to trigger the cloning process #. Ironic will reboot baremetal and launch IPA #. Ironic conductor controls IPA to expose the baremetal local disk via iSCSI #. Ironic call Cinder API to prepare Cinder volume and do local-attach #. Ironic 'copy' baremetal iSCSI disk to Cinder local attached disk #. Ironic reboot baremetal to local disk #. Ironic 'reset/unconfigure' the cinder local attached disk image, such as removing SSH host keys, removing persistent network MAC configuration, and removing user accounts etc. #. Ironic detect the config-drive and delete it if existing #. Ironic mark node as 'cloned' state, and timestamp the cloned date, save the cinder volume id #. User can boot the cloned image from cinder volume to more bare metals. Proposed change =============== * Add REST APIs end points to trigger the backup operation. For details see REST API Impact section. + {POST} /v1/nodes/<node_id>/clone <start/cancel> * Define generic `CloneInterface`` interface as extension points Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- Add new node properties: * node.clone_state: CLONING/CLONED/CLONE_FAIL Add new table 'clone_history' to trace clone history * clone_history.node_id * clone_history.cloned_date * clone_history.storage(cinder or glance) * clone_history.disk_id(for cinder, it is volume id, and for glance, it is image id) * clone_history.tags * clone_history.comments State Machine Impact -------------------- This needs add new cloning states which are responding to the relevant situation of bare metal node: INITIAL CLONING CLONED CLONE_FAIL REST API impact --------------- A new REST API will be introduced. - ``/v1/nodes/<node_id>/clone`` A new REST API to retrieve the clone history. - ``/v1/nodes/<node_id>/clone_history`` Client (CLI) impact ------------------- * A new ``NodeCloneManager`` will be added to ``ironicclient`` to trigger the clone operation the node. Also the CLIs will be as follows:: ironic node-clone --node <node> --type [clone/cancel] ironic node-clone-history [--node <node>] RPC API impact -------------- Will add new clone RPC API. Driver API impact ----------------- Will add new clone interface ``CloneInterface`` which should be implemented for each clone driver. * def prepare_clone(self, task): * def clone_baremetal_disk(self, task): By default, we will implement CinderDriver to work with cinder volume to clone user disk to cinder volume. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. Security impact --------------- Will touch user data, so require the encryption backend storage to save user images. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ This needs power off the bare metal node to do the backup operation, but it's not a big impact and it's important for enterprise users. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: whaom Other contributors: Work Items ---------- * Develop new clone API * Develop new Clone FSM * Develop new RPC API * Develop new Driver Interface * Develop new cloning reference implementation working with cinder volume * Develop new clone data model * Develop new client CLI * Develop new clone tempest cases Dependencies ============ * Cinder volume local attachment: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263744/ Without this feature, we can 'copy' baremetal disk image file to ironic conductor node, and mount it as loop device, to run disk command to * Ironic boot from cinder volume: Without this feature, we can import cinder volume into glance, and boot from glance image. Testing ======= * Unit tests will be added/updated to cover the changes. * Tempest tests will be added to Ironic to ensure that the following newly added API endpoints work correctly. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None. Documentation Impact ==================== Developer documentations such as Installation guide and RESTful web API will be updated to explain the newly added fields and end points. * Installation guide: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/install-guide.html * RESTful web API: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/webapi/v1.html References ========== .. [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/backup-disk-to-image .. [2] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wck1FfMgXh4
